original_title: SriLankan Catering employee arrested with smuggled gold at BIA
original_body_lines: An employee of SriLankan Catering has been arrested by the officers of Sri Lanka Customs Narcotics Control Division, at the exit terminal of the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake along with smuggled gold biscuits worth over Rs. 170 million.
The suspect was arrested when he was leaving the BIA via the staff exit gate of the airport departure terminal, the Sri Lanka Customs said.
There, a total of 66 gold biscuits which were hidden in the underwear of the suspect in question, had been found by the officers of Sri Lanka Customs.
It is reported that the stock of gold seized is 07 kg and 700 grams in weight and that it is estimated to be worth over Rs. 170,600,000.
The arrested suspect is an employee who has worked at SriLankan Catering for over 15 years, according to Sri Lanka Customs.
Preliminary investigations have revealed that the stock of gold in question was given to the suspect by a certain individual within the canteen of BIA’s immigration passenger terminal.
